intro: Jatropha spinosa var. somalensis, commonly known as the Somali spurge, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa, particularly Somalia and Ethiopia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to dry climates. The plant produces yellow flowers and has milky sap, which is characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive spiny or serrated edge. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
